Posts.Content: CONGRATUATIONS !!! It is a wonderful feeling, I finished a month ago. Have fun in Europe, let me know how your trip was I am planning on going next March with my daughter when she finishes Vet school. Have fun and god bless. Susan
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35
Posts.Title: I'm Finished! I'm Finished!

Posts.Content: Hi Marion, My daughter will be taking her boards in Nov this year up at The Atlantic Veterinary School in Prince Edward Island CA. She has her horse up there on a farm with her. She wants to specialize in Equine. She has been riding since she has been 5. It was a hard year last year when I got diagnosed she wanted to take a year off to come home and be with me because I live alone. I convinced her to continue her life and some close friends helped w/treatments, unlimited phone service and the airlines helped her feel connected also after chemo, b/4 rad. I turned 50 and got depressed I booked trip to Cozumel Mx and we celebrated a new improved way of life there. It was great. We have been talking about Europe since she was in High School. Enjoy your trip. How long are you going for? What part of Europe are you planning on seeing? Share some of your adventures with me when you return my email address is [emailÂ protected]. It is a great feeling to be a done deal and move on. LOL Susan
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35
Posts.Title: I'm Finished! I'm Finished!

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I believe that staging is important for planning out your best plan of treatment and choicing what you feel is best for your body. We are all different at this stage of the dis-ease. But after this is done, the staging just does not matter any more. We are all equally in this together and we can drive ourselves nuts going over statistics. Trust me I have but it is not worth wasting time what ifs,and should ofs dont matter. I just finished my rad. treatment 3 weeks ago and it is a done deal. This was the hardest journey of my life but has also been a learning one. I am grateful for all the caring, wonderful people and changes in my life that occured during treatment. A must read book is Return to Wholeness by David Simon, MD, forward by my favorite author Deepak Chorpra. It is geared to people facing cancer. lol Susan
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35

Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35
Posts.Title: Treatment for early stage bc

Posts.Content: Hi Girls, Congrats on completion of chemo that is huge. It was for me I finished Feb.15 and rads a month ago. You feelings are normal I go from feeling on top of the world to tears at times for no reason. Just releasing the fears of this dreaded dis-ease. I look at my treatments as a done deal we cant live in the past or we miss out on today. There is no guarantys for anyone in life. I just finished a great book by David Simon, MD called Return to Wholeness (embracing body,mind, and spirit in the face of Cancer) foreword by my favorite author Deepak Chopra MD. I highly recommend it also has alot of suggestions about going thru treatments. I also release my fears by just being outside walking, gardening, hiking and do daily reiki and weekly yoga. I start back full time to work this week after almost 7 months that will be a challenge. To me the Radiation was a piece of cake compared towards the chemo. I did feel more fatigue but the doctor told me she thought it was cumulative from the chemo. The hospital I went to gave free weekly reiki, ask if they do and try some. LOL Susan
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35
Posts.Title: Finished Chemo!

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone,I need some advice on trying to find a natual product for helping with hot flashes. I found this in the health food store. My doctor had never heard of it and said if it didnt have any estrogen based bi-products it would be fine to try, but she knew nothing about it. She suggested effexor if I dont come up with another solution. I will be returning to work in a couple of weeks so I am trying to get this under control. I walk everyday but intent to exercise more once I can get more energy. I was told exercise helps. Just finished my last booster dose of radiation yesterday, what a great feeling to be done treatment. Strange thing now that I have had BC, and my hair is so, so short, so many people have come up to me that are BC survivors. One of my nurses at a place I had moles removed is a 17year survivor, another 14years and last was 2years. That was just last week. We do all need to band together to fight this horrible monster and stop it. Places like this are a good place to start, thanks for your help, God Bless, Hugs Susan
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35
Posts.Title: Lachesis Mutus for hot flashes

Posts.Content: Hi Nancy, Thanks for the information I have been unable to find out anything on this just wanted to try something with no chemicals but now not sure if I like what this does either. My doctor had no information good or bad on it. Maybe I will try to exercise more first, Good luck in Talledega , (is that a race ? ) Also, you are such a positive person I am sure the results will be fine, I wonder do we ever get past the worry and uncertainity of this dis-ease. My next checkups are not until August, then have 3 in a roll. Take care and have fun. Susan
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35
Posts.Title: Lachesis Mutus for hot flashes

Posts.Content: Hi I finished dose/dense A/C chemo on Feb. 15 (everyone that is just starting it is not so bad goes by fast you want to talk email me)and now I am on my third week of radiation 35 in all. My oncologist did not believe in vitamins or supplements so I started juicing and ate real good . My radiologist suggest a womans one a day. My concern is that I am not taking in enough calcium. I just turned 50 the chemo put me in menopause and I believe that depletes your calcium. I do have a cup of yogurt and milk in cereal or at times I have a glass and eat cheese. Also I do eat healthy but do you get all the vitamins you need from food. My reiki master who is also a holistic nurse, does not believe we do unless you get fresh veggies everyday from garden which at this time of year is not possible. PS. Reiki is wonderful, made a huge difference for me going thru chemo. Any suggestions would be appreciated.
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35
Posts.Title: vitamins

Posts.Content: Hi Kristen and AtlaskaAngel, Thanks for the advise at least I now have an idea on what to shoot for. I just felt I needed more than one a day. I do drink milk, eat yogurt and cheese, so I will probably start with 600 w/d, I just came home from a healing drum circle (vibrational energy). I had alot of fun pounding on that drum , chanting and dancing. You have to try it sometime it was not what I expected. Alot of positive, strong, energy. I know what you mean about the light at the end of the tunnel, I am excited now that my eyelashes are growing back, funny that I didnt miss them when they were gone. It has been 7 weeks since my last chemo my hair seems to be taking its time alot of peach fuzz. does any one know how long it does take to grow back? Thanks for the advice and support . love and hugs
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed Sept 23 Lumpectomy on Oct 4 2004, stage IIA 2 1/2 cm node negative, grade 3 completed 4 rounds A/C 4 TAXOL dose dense, now on second week of radiation need 35
Posts.Title: vitamins

Posts.Content: Hi Leo thanks for the reply do you know what the standard amount of cacium is for a 50 year old woman that just finished chemo. I cant seem to get a straight answer from anyone. Also went in to have moles checked to have off last week do not want anything that could lead to cancer on my body.Most are scheduled to come off the end of month but one was questionable and I am again going to a cancer specialist to have ck today. I am trying to look at this as good b/c it is one on my arm that to me looked normal but was a bit raised. Quick question wouldnt the chemo affect that also? Just hard to be seeing the end in site too have to think about this now. Thanks again for the reply.
